sample_description: Bulk regolith soil, most extensively characterized lunar sample
sources: Meyer, C. (2009). Lunar Sample Compendium: 10084. NASA Johnson Space Center.
Heiken, G.H., Vaniman, D.T., & French, B.M. (1991). Lunar Sourcebook. Cambridge University Press.
Korotev, R.L. The chemical composition of lunar soil. Washington University in St. Louis.

sample_description: Bulk regolith soil from ALSEP site, well-gardened surface soil
sources: Meyer, C. (2007). Lunar Sample Compendium: 12070. NASA Johnson Space Center.
Heiken, G.H., Vaniman, D.T., & French, B.M. (1991). Lunar Sourcebook. Cambridge University Press.
Korotev, R.L. The chemical composition of lunar soil. Washington University in St. Louis.

sample_description: Comprehensive regolith soil from Fra Mauro formation, KREEP-rich highland material
sources: Meyer, C. (2011). Lunar Sample Compendium: 14163/14259. NASA Johnson Space Center.
Heiken, G.H., Vaniman, D.T., & French, B.M. (1991). Lunar Sourcebook. Cambridge University Press.
Korotev, R.L. The chemical composition of lunar soil. Washington University in St. Louis.

type: Mare/Highland boundary (Low-Ti Basalt with Highland component)
sample_description: Reference regolith soil from station 2 near Hadley Rille, mare-highland mixed soil
sources: Meyer, C. (2010). Lunar Sample Compendium: 15271. Lunar and Planetary Institute.
Heiken, G.H., Vaniman, D.T., & French, B.M. (1991). Lunar Sourcebook. Cambridge University Press.
Korotev, R.L. The chemical composition of lunar soil. Washington University in St. Louis.

sample_description: Bulk regolith soil from station LM/ALSEP area, feldspathic highland regolith
sources: Meyer, C. (2010). Lunar Sample Compendium: 60050/60500. NASA Johnson Space Center.
Heiken, G.H., Vaniman, D.T., & French, B.M. (1991). Lunar Sourcebook. Cambridge University Press.
Korotev, R.L. The chemical composition of lunar soil. Washington University in St. Louis.
Laul, J.C. & Schmitt, R.A. (1973). Chemical composition of Apollo 15, 16, and 17 samples. Proc. 4th Lunar Sci. Conf., 1349-1367.

type: Mare/Highland boundary (High-Ti Basalt with Highland component)
sample_description: Bulk regolith soil from station 1A near Steno Crater, mare-highland mixed regolith
sources: Meyer, C. (2010). Lunar Sample Compendium: 71500/71501. Lunar and Planetary Institute.
Heiken, G.H., Vaniman, D.T., & French, B.M. (1991). Lunar Sourcebook. Cambridge University Press.
Korotev, R.L. The chemical composition of lunar soil. Washington University in St. Louis.
Laul, J.C. & Schmitt, R.A. (1973). Chemical composition of Apollo 15, 16, and 17 samples. Proc. 4th Lunar Sci. Conf., 1349-1367.

sample_description: Scooped regolith from lunar surface, youngest known mare basalt (~2.0 Ga), low-Ti/low-Al/low-K type
sources: Li, C., Hu, H., Yang, M.F. et al. (2022). Characteristics of the lunar samples returned by the Chang'E-5 mission. National Science Review, 9(2), nwab188.
Zong, K., Wang, Z., Li, J. et al. (2022). Bulk compositions of the Chang'E-5 lunar soil. Geochimica et Cosmochimica Acta, 335, 284-296.
Xu, Y., Tian, H., Zhang, C. et al. (2022). Simultaneous analysis of particle size and mineralogy for Chang'E-5 lunar soil. Science China Earth Sciences, 65, 1-14.
